Hi.

I am currently developing J-LO [1], a tool for runtime testing temporal
assertions in Java. The tool tests temporal constraints on a running Java
application. At the moment, whenever such a constraint is violated, this is
output to the commandline. I would like to provide a second observer, which
reports violated/fulfilled constraints to one of the available JUnit UIs.
Could anyone give me some insstructions how this could easily be
accomplished? Or maybe this has even been done before and I could look at
some code!?

Thanks a lot,
Eric

[1] http://www-i2.informatik.rwth-aachen.de/JLO/

--
Eric Bodden
Chair I2 for Programming Languages and Program Analysis
RWTH Aachen University
